article:
:This article is about the physical measurement. For other uses of the term,
see [[Reach]]

'Arm span' or 'reach' (sometimes referred to as wingspan) is the physical
measurement of the length from one end of an individual's arms (measured at the
fingertips) to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height
at a one-hundred eighty degree angle. The average reach correlates to the
person's height. Age and sex have to be taken into account to best predict
height from arm
span. http://erj.ersjournals.com/content/37/1/157.abstract
